oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Jerrod Niemann - 2017-06-17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Jerrod Niemann from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on June 17, 2017. File includes set up for the next days program.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jerrod Niemann;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (03:11) Opening comments and introduction of Jerrod Niemann by Abi Tapia / (07:12) Opening comments by Jerrod, introduction of Tim Teague and story about meeting and songwriting with Garth Brooks / (13:27) Performs Good Ride Cowboy / (16:24) Tells story about writing the next song / (19:14) Performs My Saving Grace / (22:37) Tells story about early days in Nashville / (26:39) Performs Redneck Side Of Me / (30:37) Tells story about Chris Dubois and writing the next song / (34:19) Performs They Should Have Named You Cocaine / (38:02) Tells story about writing the next song / (39:08) Performs One More Drinkin' Song / (41:40) Tells story about next song / (44:04) Performs What Do You Want / (47:28) Tells story about the next song / (50:49) Old School New Again / (54:39) Closing comments / (54:56) Walk-out music / (0:04:17) Program end / (01:08:26) Walk-out music continues with set up for next program /

(01:13:32) Sound check for next program with Andrea Zonn including run through of the song Another Swing And A Miss / (01:33:20) Sound check of Crazy If You Let It - excerpt / (01:34:45) Sound check of Rise - excerpt / (01:38:01) Bill Lloyd and Andrea Zonn with sound check from interview chairs / (01:43:31) Pre-recorded music and mic check / 02:11:27) Walk-in music for next program / (02:12:21) FILE END.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Niemann, Jerrod; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
